alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Essex; Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 07 at 11:58AM EDT until October 08 at 6:10PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following counties, Clinton, Essex and Franklin. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from current rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1156 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Essex County dispatch also reported minor flooding in the Keene Valley area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area through this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lake Placid, Plattsburgh International Airport, Plattsburgh, Peru, Beekmantown, Schuyler Falls, Chazy, Saranac, Mooers, Altona, Wilmington, Elizabethtown, Keene, Minerva, Jay In Essex County, Au Sable Forks, Keene Valley, Peasleeville and Keeseville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. Stream banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
